Title: Aircrack-ng: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
A buffer overflow vulnerability in Aircrack-ng could result in
    execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.

Background.Text: Aircrack-ng is an 802.11 WEP and WPA-PSK keys cracking program that can recover keys once enough data packets have been captured.

Description.Text: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in Aircrack-ng.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted dump file using Aircrack-ng, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Aircrack-ng users should upgrade to the latest version:
